column4: Most Ubuntu users don't care about such things, no need to explain them here, this is a support channel, not an informational channel
i guess that's an invitation to leave.        fair enough.
when did ubuntu-restricted-extras appear in the repos ?
interesting i don't have that package in dapper 6.6
oh, so there is no way to convince you to upgrade to at least hardy? Ubuntu has made a lot of strides since back then
i was only wondering when the package appeared seeing that i don't have it.   i'm not having but the one issue, as i posted earlier  can't find message bus   but no one answered
I'm just saying, dapper is OLD... you might as well be using Windows 98 compared to where Linux is 3 years later
i think i might prefer to be
i mean, i don't really like the dirrection it's moving, so why try to keep up?  i still use primarily the console and don't want any machine to do anything that i don't specificly tell it to.
The direction its going? its open source... just start out with a server installer and don't install what you don't want?
and hardy would be an improvement over dapper in what way if i do what you said ???
name it... performance, hardware support, etc etc

heh, all my hardware is fully supported under dapper, or as fully as it is under any later version; to get one gfx card supported i would have to revert to something with a 2.4 kernel.   as per performance.   are you saying that the 2.6.18 kernel will outperforme the 2.6.15 ?   or was that a refferance to upstart -vs- sysV ?
